section.en: Do you agree with the following statements?

label.en: [groupID]. Appropriate monetary policy stance – European Central Bank

description.en: The European Central Bank should take its time to normalize its interest rates. There is no need to increase central bank rates in Europe before the year 2020.

label.en: [groupID]. Appropriate monetary policy stance – US Federal Reserve

description.en: The US Federal Reserve should continue with its course of interest rate increases well throughout 2019.
Overall, the current economic situation in industrial countries allows more fiscal consolidation. OECD countries should consolidate more and try to reduce government debt.

In general, the large involvement of governments in market activities still impairs the growth potential of industrial countries. Privatization should be one of the priorities in strategies to boost the growth potential in OECD countries.

High long-run unemployment in some OECD countries largely reflects an excessive level of labor market regulation. In order to reduce this unemployment, countries would have to deregulate labor markets.
Current inequalities in OECD countries are not just a fairness issue but also detrimental for the growth potential. Governments should address these inequalities by more intense redistribution.

Fiscal rules like the European Stability and Growth Pact constrain government on the size of the government deficit. Rules like this may not be perfectly effective but, in principle, they are helpful and support long-run economic stability.

description.de: Danke für Ihre Teilnahme an unserer Umfrage.
description.en: Thank you for your participation in our survey.
description.es: Gracias por haber contestado a nuestro cuestionario.
description.fr: Nous vous remercions d'avoir répondu à nos questions.
description.it: Grazie per aver risposto al nostro questionario.
Le Sue risposte sono state salvate.
